snippet: A man charged with assaulting an officer had his case dismissed after a grand jury watched footage of the encounter, which may be crucial evidence in a lawsuit filed in federal court.
abstract: Luis Solivan, Bronx man charged with assaulting two New York police officers, had his case dismissed after a grand jury watched a video of the encounter; same footage may now emerge as crucial evidence in a federal civil rights lawsuit filed by Solivan's lawyers, who allege that the officers savagely beat Solivan after he had been chased into his own apartment and was already handcuffed.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and RANDY LEONARD

lead_paragraph: A man charged with assaulting an officer had his case dismissed after a grand jury watched footage of the encounter, which may be crucial evidence in a lawsuit filed in federal court.

headline.seo: Video of Police Encounter May Take Key Role in Civil Rights Suit
headline.main: Video of Police Encounter May Play Lead Role in Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Video of Police Encounter May Play Lead Role in Lawsuit
